tool.name: faToVcf
tool.description: Convert a FASTA alignment file to Variant Call Format (VCF) single-nucleotide diffs
tool.command: #if $in_fasta ln -s '$in_fasta' in.fa && #end if faToVcf in.fa out.vcf #if $ref_seq.refSeq == "customRef" -ref=$ref_seq.ref #end if #if $startOffset -startOffset=$startOffset #end if #if $ambiguous == "-ambiguousToN" -ambiguousToN #elif $ambiguous == "-resolveAmbiguous" -resolveAmbiguous #end if #if $excl_seq.excludeFile -excludeFile='$excl_seq.excludeFile' #end if -maxDiff=$excl_seq.maxDiff #if $mask_sites.maskSites -maskSites='$mask_sites.maskSites' #end if -windowSize=$mask_sites.windowSize -minAmbigInWindow=$mask_sites.minAmbigInWindow $includeNoAltN -minAc=$minAc -minAf=$minAf $output.includeRef $output.noGenotypes #if $output.vcfChrom -vcfChrom='$output.vcfChrom' #end if

param.name: in_fasta
param.label: FASTA Alignment
param.help: Must contain a series of sequences with different names and the same length. Both N and - are treated as missing information.

param.name: refSeq
param.label: Determine reference sequence
param.help: Which sequence from the FASTA file should be used as the reference sequence.
param.option: Use the first sequence as reference
Use a different sequence as reference

param.label: Name of sequence that should be used as reference sequence:
param.help: Must be present in the FASTA file.

param.label: Start offset
param.help: Add N bases to each position, e.g. for trimmed alignments. Default: 0

param.name: ambiguous
param.label: Treat ambiguous bases
param.help: If 1: Treat ambiguous bases as N, ambiguous bases (N, R, V etc.) are treated as N (no call). If 2: Resolve ambiguous characters, if the character represents two bases and one is the reference base, convert it to the non-reference base. Otherwise convert it to N. Default: 0: Don't treat ambiguous bases
param.option: 1: Treat ambiguous bases as N (no call)

param.label: Exclude sequences from text file
param.help: Exclude sequences named in file which has one sequence name per line.

param.label: Maximum number of mismatches
param.help: Exclude sequences with more than N mismatches with the reference sequence. If -windowSize is used, sequences are masked accordingly before the mismatches are counted. Default: 0

param.label: Mask sites at given positions (VCF file)
param.help: Exclude variants in positions recommended for masking in file. Typically https://github.com/W-L/ProblematicSites_SARS-CoV2/raw/master/problematic_sites_sarsCov2.vcf

param.label: Window size to mask bases
param.help: Mask any base for which there are at least -minAmbigWindow bases in a window of +-N bases around the base. Masking approach adapted from https://github.com/roblanf/sarscov2phylo/blob/master/scripts/mask_seq.py Use -windowSize=7 for same results. Default: 0

param.label: Minimum of ambiguous characters within the window given above
param.help: When -windowSize is provided, mask any base for which there are at least this many N, ambiguous or gap characters within the window. Default: 2

param.label: Include base positions
param.help: Include base positions with no alternate alleles observed, but at least one N (missing base/no-call). Default: false

param.label: Minimum allele count
param.help: Ignore alternate alleles observed fewer than N times. Default: 0

param.label: Minimum allele frequency
param.help: Ignore alternate alleles observed in less than F of non-N bases. Default: 0.0

param.label: Include the reference in the genotype columns
Output 8-column VCF
param.help: VCF without the sample genotype columns. Default: false

param.label: Use this sequence for the CHROM column in the VCF
param.help: Default: name of the reference sequence.

tool.help:
**What it does**
`faToVcf`_ is a tool to extract a VCF from a multi-sequence FASTA alignment.
.. _faToVcf: http://hgdownload.cse.ucsc.edu/admin/exe/linux.x86_64/FOOTER.txt
